file_content.text: Nothing yet from the other caves. The scum can hide out here practically for forever.
Good work on those Force users. If some legendary hero rose out of this backwater, we'd never hear the end of it.
There's not much for you here. The cave's over in Broken Valley.
Our battalion may have been unable to assist the platoon at Okara, but I assure you they were not sitting idle.
Aurek and Cresh companies and the remainder of Besh simultaneously invaded rebel posts in Broken Valley. They found something.
I always like field intel.
What's the news?
Then I've got a gift for you.
Do not keep me waiting.
Keep talking.
Yes, my lord.
Give me something actionable.
Hurry it up.
I'm getting to it. I don't have some neatly packaged assassination dossier--this is fresh off the comm.
This success does not seem to have eased your mind.
You seem uneasy.
I am anticipating the next conflict, my lord. It could prove equally as dangerous.
What was it?
I'm glad someone in this outfit succeeds on the first try.
Good news... for once.
Yes, we've become good at deciphering the mess that Imperial Intelligence sends our way.
Our droids went through the rebel databanks and pulled out messages about them occupying a tunnel network we call Cave 52.
The rebels are in Broken Valley, and they're moving in cargo. All indications are that this load is special.
Like what?
Indications?
To protect this cargo, they transferred in one of their elite units from a continent away.
So what?
Bombs work wonders on caves. Have you contacted the air force?
One bomb could finish them.
No, we want the cave contents undamaged. The rebels transferred in elite units--this is something they don't want us to have.
If our whole battalion comes knocking, they'll evacuate immediately. We need a small, fast attack to get inside Cave 52.
The guerrillas know the tunnels quite well, so I suspect they have ambush points.
It doesn't matter where they hide. Their fate will be the same.
I can get in there.
They'll die anyway.
Good. Word will spread about the captured posts, so I would head to Broken Valley immediately.
We'll have a surveillance officer monitoring Cave 52's largest entrance. His name is Trecht.
When you've seen the cargo, report to him, and he'll contact me on a secure frequency. Go in strength.
If your battalion covers the exits, you will find your numbers more than adequate.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
If we knew where all the exits were, we wouldn't be talking.
Lieutenant Rutau reported in. He says you completed the platoon's objective alone.
Rutau is too humble. He expended great effort to carry on the mission.
He deserves some credit.
We will recover him when possible. Now, a new development demands attention.
Wasn't hard.
I had a feeling you'd say that. It seems if I want to save my men's lives, I should send you in first instead of last.
I hope you understand never to commit your troops like this again.
You got them killed.
Rutau's men had a time-dependent mission, as did all other available units. Lack of reinforcements was an accepted risk.
I wish we could find the platoon some other way, but going on foot is the most secure move.
Keep trying to raise them. I may have another avenue.
My lord, I'm Major Tyrus, commander of the Second Battalion. We have an... an emerging situation.
You. Bounty hunter. I'm Major Tyrus, commander of the Second Battalion.
I'll be blunt. I need someone who can pull a rescue operation immediately and keep their mouth shut afterward.
I'm Major Tyrus, commander of the Second Battalion. I understand you work intelligence.
I'm Major Tyrus, commander of the Second Battalion.
I have need of your assistance and your discretion. We have a rescue operation that must be mounted immediately.
Is this someone important?
Who needs rescuing?
It's not a single person. We've lost contact with Besh Company's entire First Platoon.
What do you intend?
We need someone who can get on the ground and contact Besh Company's missing First Platoon.
If it's this urgent, why hide it?
Why the secrecy?
Because the colonels don't like it when you can't find an entire platoon of your top soldiers.
We sent them in to the Okara Droid Factory for a covert electronic operation.
Eight hours ago, their communications blacked out, which means the droids are on to them.
What are their chances that close to Okara?
How bad is that scenario?
I'll be frank. Other than grass, the soldiers are the only living things within a klick of that factory.
That's the droids' protocol--nothing survives. So when I say I need you to find First Platoon, I mean it.
Battle droids?
Where's the rest of your battalion?
You don't have reinforcements?
In two words? Stretched thin. I've got the rest of Besh Company and two others exterminating rebels in Broken Valley.
They'd never make it back in time. That leaves one hope for First Platoon, and I believe I'm talking to it right now.
I'll head to the Okara factory immediately.
On my way.
A worthy task.
Their ranking officer is Lieutenant Rutau. If the droids got him, then please, take command and lead the unit back.
I am committed elsewhere.
I can't help. [Refuse quest]
I see. Then I suspect those men will die.
I have other concerns.
